sentences.english: The police hustled the tramps out of town .
sentences.chinese: 警察驱逐游民离开城市。

sentences.english: He said, "Happily unemployed." And then he said, "So, Brooke!
sentences.chinese: 他说，是呀，我很庆幸我是无业游民。

sentences.english: This is God's gift to internet denizens.
sentences.chinese: 这是上帝给网络游民带来的最好的礼物。

sentences.english: A hobo, especially one who carries a bedroll.
sentences.chinese: 流浪者，游民流浪汉，尤指带着铺盖卷。

sentences.english: From now on, I became a hobo.
sentences.chinese: 从今往后，我成了无业游民。

sentences.english: Hobo Chen Quan is abjection because of business failure.
sentences.chinese: 无业游民陈全因生意失败而落魄。
她继续说，这么说你是无业游民。

sentences.english: "Hoboes" regularly knocked on their door asking for a little food.
sentences.chinese: 无业游民经常敲他们家的门讨点儿吃的。

sentences.english: Arnold was an elderly hobo whose life was simple and uncomplicated.
sentences.chinese: 阿诺是生活是简单而不复杂的一个年老的无业游民。

sentences.english: I am white, I am a fuckin bum, I do live in a trailer with my mom .
sentences.chinese: 说我是白人，游民一个，我和妈妈住在拖车里。
他们是无业游民中的圣战者。

definition: good people/ordinary people (i.e. not the lowest class)
not to do anything productive/to idle away one's time
to await job assignment (term used only in mainland China)
(PRC) flow of people from the countryside into the cities/rural migrant without definite prospects/drifter
Pirate Party, political movement whose main goal is to reform copyright law in line with the Internet era
to scrape a meager living/to get by with difficulty
